wiki.text:
The 'cash surrender value' is the sum of money an insurance company will pay to
the policyholder or annuity holder in the event his or her policy is voluntarily
terminated before its maturity or the insured event occurs. This cash value is
the savings component of most permanent life insurance policies, particularly
whole life insurance policies. It is also known as "cash value", "surrender
value" and "policyholder's equity". This amount is net of any surrender charges
and outstanding policy loans and interest thereon.

A life settlement can be a way in which a policyholder receives more cash for
his policy.
wiki.title: cash surrender value
